Points on a circle

Given a circle with centre \((a, b) \) and radius \(r\), we can determine whether a point \((p,q)\) lies within, outside of, or on the circumference of the circle using the following:

  1. \((p−a)^2 +(q−b)^2 < r^2 \iff \) the point lies within the circle.
  2. \((p−a)^2 +(q−b)^2 =r^2 \iff\) the point lies on (the circumference of) the circle.
  3. \((p−a)^2 +(q−b)^2 >r^2 \iff\) the point lies outside of the circle
